snippet: One of South America’s most active volcanoes erupted early Tuesday in southern Chile, spewing heavy smoke into the air as lava surged down its slopes and prompting the authorities to evacuate about 3,500 people.
abstract: Villarrica volcano erupts, spewing ash, smoke and lava and prompting Chile's National Emergency Office to issue red alert and evacuate 3,500 people; 9,000 foot volcano, which sits above city of Pucon, is most active in South America.
lead_paragraph: One of South America’s most active volcanoes erupted early Tuesday in southern Chile, spewing heavy smoke into the air as lava surged down its slopes and prompting the authorities to evacuate about 3,500 people.
